headline: Australia looks to scrap surcharges on most card payments
summary: SYDNEY (Reuters) -Australia's central bank on Tuesday proposed to scrap surcharges on most debit and credit card payments for consumers while lowering interchange fees paid by businesses, steps it estimated would save the two groups around A$2.4 billion ($1.57 billion) a year.  In a consultation paper on the proposals, the Reserve Bank of Australia said surcharges and fees were no longer in the public interest and invited feedback from interested parties by August 26.  The RBA judged that surcharges on debit and credit cards, including Mastercard and Visa, no longer achieved the intended purpose of steering consumers to make more efficient payment choices.

The RBA judged that surcharges on debit and credit cards, including Mastercard and Visa, no longer achieved the intended purpose of steering consumers to make more efficient payment choices.

headline: Mastercard Incorporated to Host Conference Call on Second Quarter 2025 Financial Results
summary: PURCHASE, N.Y., July 14, 2025--On Thursday, July 31, 2025, Mastercard will release its second quarter 2025 financial results.

headline: Apple doesn’t threaten Visa, Mastercard, judge rules
summary: Merchant arguments that Apple could displace Visa or Mastercard’s network dominance failed to support an antitrust case on swipe fees, a court found.

raw.headline: Apple doesn’t threaten Visa, Mastercard, judge rules
raw.summary: Merchant arguments that Apple could displace Visa or Mastercard’s network dominance failed to support an antitrust case on swipe fees, a court found.
